fields.title: Situation Update #157 - Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) WHO Country Office for Nepal Reporting Date: 10 - 16 April 2023 (Epi Week 15)
fields.body:
**HIGHLIGHTS**

*(Data published in the MoHP Situation Report as of 16 April 2023 and same data published in EDCD Report as of 17 April 2023)*

• Of the total RT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 cases, 98.7% (989,779) of cases have recovered, 0.01% (378) are active cases, and 1.19% (12,022) are deaths.

• Among the new RT-PCR confirmed cases (378) reported this week, 55.6% (210 cases) are from Kathmandu district followed by Lalitpur district with 10.1% (38 cases). Majority of the new cases 68.5% (259) have been reported from Kathmandu Valley (Kathmandu, Lalitpur, and Bhaktapur) in Bagmati Province.

text:
# Situation Update #157 - Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) WHO Country Office for Nepal Reporting Date: 10 - 16 April 2023 (Epi Week 15)

**HIGHLIGHTS**

*(Data published in the MoHP Situation Report as of 16 April 2023 and same data published in EDCD Report as of 17 April 2023)*

• Of the total RT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 cases, 98.7% (989,779) of cases have recovered, 0.01% (378) are active cases, and 1.19% (12,022) are deaths.

• Among the new RT-PCR confirmed cases (378) reported this week, 55.6% (210 cases) are from Kathmandu district followed by Lalitpur district with 10.1% (38 cases). Majority of the new cases 68.5% (259) have been reported from Kathmandu Valley (Kathmandu, Lalitpur, and Bhaktapur) in Bagmati Province.
summary: This week, there were 378 new RT-PCR confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Nepal, with the majority (210 cases) coming from Kathmandu district and 68.5% (259 cases) from the Kathmandu Valley. Of the total RT-PCR confirmed cases, 98.7% (989,779) have recovered, 0.01% (378) are active cases, and 1.19% (12,022) are deaths.
